programme.title: Get Santa
Get Santa
programme.desc:
Get Santa: Directed by Christopher Smith. With Jim Broadbent, Rafe Spall, Kit Connor, Ewen Bremner. A father and son who team up to save Christmas once they discover Santa Claus sleeping in their garage after crashing his sleigh and finding himself on the run from the police." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1935940/","name":"Get Santa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU0OTk3MDg1Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk0MjkxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father and son who team up to save Christmas once they discover Santa Claus sleeping in their garage after crashing his sleigh and finding himself on the run from the police.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1935940/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"inquizitors-845-455978"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just enjoy!","reviewBody":"Some people take everything so seriously. This is a fun Christmas film that I have witnessed being enjoyed by a large group aged from 4 to 72. It is no classic but is good fun with all the characters to see the good versus bad battle. Just relax with a mince pie and your favourite tipple - or a nice cuppa - and enjoy this harmless festive fun film.

A 9-year-old boy Tom finds Santa Claus in his garden shed after Santa crashes his sleigh. Desperate to return to Lapland in time for Christmas, Santa asks Tom and his dad Steve for help. It's just a few days before Christmas, and his reindeer are found running loose through the streets of London.

Give it a watch. It is harmless fun. Jim Bradbent is a brilliant Santa and adds to his catalogue of very different roles. Rafe Spall is excellent as the dad released from prison trying to help his young son surrounded by cynical people in all guises. Kit Connor is the 9 year old boy who is the star of the movie and is excellent.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2014-12-05","keywords":"santa claus,christmas,ex convict,release from prison,reindeer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Santa","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi381796121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY1NDA4YjUtZjUzYi00YWU0LThhYmYtYzE2OTVlMzZkYmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY1NDA4YjUtZjUzYi00YWU0LThhYmYtYzE2OTVlMzZkYmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000980/","name":"Jim Broadbent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5598573/","name":"Kit Connor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1247462/","name":"Christopher Smith"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001935/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1247462/","name":"Christopher Smith"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1935940, Title: Get Santa, --- Description: Get Santa: Directed by Christopher Smith. With Jim Broadbent, Rafe Spall, Kit Connor, Ewen Bremner. A father and son who team up to save Christmas once they discover Santa Claus sleeping in their garage after crashing his sleigh and finding himself on the run from the police." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1935940/","name":"Get Santa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU0OTk3MDg1Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk0MjkxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father and son who team up to save Christmas once they discover Santa Claus sleeping in their garage after crashing his sleigh and finding himself on the run from the police.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1935940/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"inquizitors-845-455978","dateCreated":"2016-12-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just enjoy!","reviewBody":"Some people take everything so seriously. This is a fun Christmas film that I have witnessed being enjoyed by a large group aged from 4 to 72. It is no classic but is good fun with all the characters to see the good versus bad battle. Just relax with a mince pie and your favourite tipple - or a nice cuppa - and enjoy this harmless festive fun film.

A 9-year-old boy Tom finds Santa Claus in his garden shed after Santa crashes his sleigh. Desperate to return to Lapland in time for Christmas, Santa asks Tom and his dad Steve for help. It's just a few days before Christmas, and his reindeer are found running loose through the streets of London.

Give it a watch. It is harmless fun. Jim Bradbent is a brilliant Santa and adds to his catalogue of very different roles. Rafe Spall is excellent as the dad released from prison trying to help his young son surrounded by cynical people in all guises. Kit Connor is the 9 year old boy who is the star of the movie and is excellent.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2014-12-05","keywords":"santa claus,christmas,ex convict,release from prison,reindeer","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Santa","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi381796121","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY1NDA4YjUtZjUzYi00YWU0LThhYmYtYzE2OTVlMzZkYmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY1NDA4YjUtZjUzYi00YWU0LThhYmYtYzE2OTVlMzZkYmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000980/","name":"Jim Broadbent","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5598573/","name":"Kit Connor"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1247462/","name":"Christopher Smith"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001935/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1247462/","name":"Christopher Smith"],"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Polar Express
Der Polarexpress
programme.desc:
The Polar Express: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Tom Hanks, Leslie Zemeckis, Eddie Deezen, Nona Gaye. On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338348/","name":"The Polar Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NTU0NTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sak007"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Should become a holiday classic","reviewBody":"A simple story . . . beautifully told . . . magnificently visualized.

The IMAX experience was stunning.

I did not expect to enjoy the story as much as I did. Simple but quite heartwarming.

Although it started a bit slow, it continued to gain momentum (no train analogy intended) through its conclusion. I was not a great lover of the animation of the human characters, but the other animation, whether it be the train, the scenery, the reindeer, or the elves (are elves human?) was quite well done. 

Perhaps the best review I can provide is that after I watched the Polar Express, I just felt happier.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":191455,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-12-22","keywords":"santa claus character,christmas movie,male protagonist,based on children's book,train engineer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Polar Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2954167065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy's fantastical train journey to the North Pole"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178875/","name":"Chris Coppola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005052/","name":"Michael Jeter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036807/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036575/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885575/","name":"Chris Van Allsburg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115310/","name":"William Broyles Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: New Year's Eve
Happy New Year
programme.desc:
New Year's Eve: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Michelle Pfeiffer, Zac Efron, Charlotte Marshall-Fricker, Fiona Choi. The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1598822/","name":"New Year's Eve","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2Mzg2MDQxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc3NTY5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1598822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyCollins"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too many story lines make New Years Eve a bit of a dud.","reviewBody":"I rather enjoy the odd ensemble comedy such as this film, I somewhat enjoyed Valentines Day and I really enjoyed He's Just Not That Into You, but what those film had but this doesn't is a fewer amount of plot lines. There's just too much going on in this film, far too many characters, as soon as I found myself interested in one plot its segment would end, you can never get really attached to one set of characters.

For me the best storyline was the Michelle Pfieffer and Zefron plot, it was really the only one with a bit of substance, I actually think a full movie of that story would be great, also the Jessica Biel and Seth Meyers plot was rather funny thanks to the highly underrated Ms Biel. This movie is entertaining enough I suppose but it's also lacking any real great laugh out loud moments, the only time I laughed was when Jessica Biel was in labour, she could do some great comedy if given the chance.

Lea Michele manages to bring her great screen charisma to the big screen, she is very fun to watch and her rendition of Aude Lang Syne was lovely and a nice way to end the movie.

If this movie had about four or five less stories happening this movie would have been much better, it's not horrible by any standards but it's not excellent either, also this may sound mean but Sofia Vergara is possibly the most annoying actress alive, at least they didn't put a decent actress in the most annoying role in the film. I mean it's worth paying to see the excellent dance scene between Zefron and Pfieffer over the end credits.

OK, but basically it's exactly the same as Valentines Day but with more actors and a lot less substance.

Enjoy. Maybe.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"ensemble film,new year,new year's eve,singer,expecting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi673095449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005110/","name":"Ashton Kutcher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Family Stone
Die Familie Stone – Verloben verboten!
programme.desc:
The Family Stone: Directed by Thomas Bezucha. With Claire Danes, Diane Keaton, Rachel McAdams, Dermot Mulroney. An uptight, conservative businesswoman accompanies her boyfriend to his eccentric and outgoing family's annual Christmas celebration and finds that she's a fish out of water in their free-spirited way of life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0356680/","name":"The Family Stone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkwMjM4MjMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjM1OTQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An uptight, conservative businesswoman accompanies her boyfriend to his eccentric and outgoing family's annual Christmas celebration and finds that she's a fish out of water in their free-spirited way of life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0356680/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"marissas75"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Talented actors have fun with a familiar premise","reviewBody":"The premise of "The Family Stone" sounds a little shopworn: Everett Stone brings his uptight girlfriend Meredith home for Christmas to meet his large family, who instantly dislike her. Even worse, the trailer reveals most of the plot's complications. However, this premise has been used so often because it reliably provides opportunities for comedy, drama, and insight into family dynamics. "The Family Stone" proves itself a better-than-average example of the genre because of its talented cast and reasonably intelligent script.

Sarah Jessica Parker's presence ensures that Meredith always remains sympathetic, even when we can also perfectly understand why she irritates the Stones. The various Stones-- Diane Keaton, Craig T. Nelson, Dermot Mulroney, Rachel McAdams, Luke Wilson--make the most of their roles, and, more importantly, they really do start to seem like a family, not a random collection of actors. The only actor who fails to make an impression is Claire Danes, who can't do much with the underwritten role of Meredith's sister Julie.

"The Family Stone" is not a groundbreaking movie, but it goes beyond the fish-out-of-water clichés that its plot might suggest. It finds the emotional truth, as well as the humor, in Meredith's situation. Plus, it's extremely evenhanded: all of the characters are flawed but likable, and in a climactic argument at the dinner table, both Meredith and Sibyl make valid points. Reviewers on this site have accused the movie of pushing a liberal agenda via its sympathetic portrayal of an interracial gay couple and a semi-bohemian family--and of pushing a conservative agenda via its portrayal of the Stones as hypocritical liberals who pay lip service to tolerance but are prejudiced against people like Meredith. Personally, I'm not sure if "The Family Stone" has any agenda, other than to cast good actors in a holiday comedy-drama that doesn't insult its audience's intelligence. And it succeeds pretty well at that.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":65094,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-02-15","keywords":"christmas,falling in love,friendship,usa,united states","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Family Stone","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi468844825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Y3ODcwNWYtODYyZS00NWVmLWFhYWEtNGI5OGMxNzc2ODNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Y3ODcwNWYtODYyZS00NWVmLWFhYWEtNGI5OGMxNzc2ODNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000551/","name":"Dermot Mulroney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0080120/","name":"Thomas Bezucha"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143569/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174362/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0080120/","name":"Thomas Bezucha"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

However, this premise has been used so often because it reliably provides opportunities for comedy, drama, and insight into family dynamics. "The Family Stone" proves itself a better-than-average example of the genre because of its talented cast and reasonably intelligent script.

Sarah Jessica Parker's presence ensures that Meredith always remains sympathetic, even when we can also perfectly understand why she irritates the Stones. The various Stones-- Diane Keaton, Craig T. Nelson, Dermot Mulroney, Rachel McAdams, Luke Wilson--make the most of their roles, and, more importantly, they really do start to seem like a family, not a random collection of actors. The only actor who fails to make an impression is Claire Danes, who can't do much with the underwritten role of Meredith's sister Julie.

"The Family Stone" is not a groundbreaking movie, but it goes beyond the fish-out-of-water clichés that its plot might suggest. It finds the emotional truth, as well as the humor, in Meredith's situation. Plus, it's extremely evenhanded: all of the characters are flawed but likable, and in a climactic argument at the dinner table, both Meredith and Sibyl make valid points. Reviewers on this site have accused the movie of pushing a liberal agenda via its sympathetic portrayal of an interracial gay couple and a semi-bohemian family--and of pushing a conservative agenda via its portrayal of the Stones as hypocritical liberals who pay lip service to tolerance but are prejudiced against people like Meredith. Personally, I'm not sure if "The Family Stone" has any agenda, other than to cast good actors in a holiday comedy-drama that doesn't insult its audience's intelligence. And it succeeds pretty well at that.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":65094,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-02-15","keywords":"christmas,falling in love,friendship,usa,united states","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Family Stone","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi468844825","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Y3ODcwNWYtODYyZS00NWVmLWFhYWEtNGI5OGMxNzc2ODNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Y3ODcwNWYtODYyZS00NWVmLWFhYWEtNGI5OGMxNzc2ODNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000551/","name":"Dermot Mulroney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0080120/","name":"Thomas Bezucha"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143569/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174362/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0080120/","name":"Thomas Bezucha"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Knocked Up
Beim ersten Mal
programme.desc: Knocked Up: Directed by Judd Apatow. With Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl, Paul Rudd, Leslie Mann. For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0478311/","name":"Knocked Up","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzgzYjMzMWItNDFiYi00ZjhkLWIyMzYtZGRlY2FmNzkwNjRhL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0478311/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"essex777"},"dateCreated":"2007-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"awful; avoid being knocked up by a bad film.","reviewBody":"i was very disappointed in this film as reviewers claimed something good and there was none, zero! i cannot think of one positive except it finally ends and magnificent quiet fills the space left by actors swearing, abusing each other, and us. save your money, tell everyone you know to do likewise and see something else. this film is classless, base, stupid, boring, dull, a total waste of time. I rarely have seen a film that was so bad that I felt compelled to post a warning to the general public to run in the opposite direction. I wanted to see it because I'd seen a few of the actors on late night shows and daytime shows where they promoted the sweetness that evolved in the story line. They went on and on with comments about depth. I find this totally hilarious in retrospect as "depth" as a description of the emotional emptiness of the characters in this film would be like someone describing insanity as the highest form of intellectual development. I was hoodwinked and hope you will not be likewise 'knocked up.'"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":360184,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-10-31","keywords":"one night stand,unplanned pregnancy,slacker,pregnancy,female nudity","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001337/","name":"Katherine Heigl"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748620/","name":"Paul Rudd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0478311, Title: Knocked Up, --- Description: Knocked Up: Directed by Judd Apatow. With Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl, Paul Rudd, Leslie Mann. For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0478311/","name":"Knocked Up","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzgzYjMzMWItNDFiYi00ZjhkLWIyMzYtZGRlY2FmNzkwNjRhL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0478311/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"essex777","dateCreated":"2007-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"awful; avoid being knocked up by a bad film.","reviewBody":"i was very disappointed in this film as reviewers claimed something good and there was none, zero! i cannot think of one positive except it finally ends and magnificent quiet fills the space left by actors swearing, abusing each other, and us. save your money, tell everyone you know to do likewise and see something else. this film is classless, base, stupid, boring, dull, a total waste of time. I rarely have seen a film that was so bad that I felt compelled to post a warning to the general public to run in the opposite direction. I wanted to see it because I'd seen a few of the actors on late night shows and daytime shows where they promoted the sweetness that evolved in the story line. They went on and on with comments about depth. I find this totally hilarious in retrospect as "depth" as a description of the emotional emptiness of the characters in this film would be like someone describing insanity as the highest form of intellectual development. I was hoodwinked and hope you will not be likewise 'knocked up.'","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":360184,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-10-31","keywords":"one night stand,unplanned pregnancy,slacker,pregnancy,female nudity","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001337/","name":"Katherine Heigl","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748620/","name":"Paul Rudd"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"],"duration":"PT2H9M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Unfinished Business
Big Business – Ausser Spesen nichts gewesen
programme.desc:
Unfinished Business: Directed by Ken Scott. With Vince Vaughn, Tom Wilkinson, Dave Franco, Sienna Miller. A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2358925/","name":"Unfinished Business","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMwYjc3ZWEtNjMxNS00MzdkLWEwYWQtYWRkMDUwZWRhMjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2358925/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"maclock"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amusing","reviewBody":"Unfinished Business was a welcome surprise. Based on what I had read about it, I was prepared to leave the theatre underwhelmed and disappointed. That did not happen, though.

Vince Vaughn and Tom Wilkinson were amusing in their roles and they seemed to get things more right than wrong when it came to delivery and to timing. The character of their simple sidekick was more than a bit annoying, but it was good to see that the characters played by Vaughn and Wilkinson cut him a lot of slack. In short, this is a better movie than many IMDb amateur reviewers would have you believe. 

I found myself chuckling more than a few times, laughing at their antics and the absurdity of it all. This was a charming and amusing film in the end. If I were to guess, then some of the reviewers here may have felt discomfort over the depictions of drinking, drug use, and sexuality in this picture. So it goes. Recommended viewing for the non-church going set."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33094,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-08","keywords":"male nudity,business trip,company,glory hole,businessman","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1415687705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every imaginable - and unimaginable - way, including unplanned stops at a massive sex fetish event and a global economic summit.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000681/","name":"Vince Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2002649/","name":"Dave Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779433/","name":"Ken Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175726/","name":"Steve Conrad"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cheaper by the Dozen
Im Dutzend billiger
programme.desc: Cheaper by the Dozen: Directed by Shawn Levy. With Steve Martin, Bonnie Hunt, Piper Perabo, Tom Welling. With his wife doing a book tour, a father of twelve must handle a new job and his unstable brood." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0349205/","name":"Cheaper by the Dozen","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0NzYxMjY0Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTU0NDczMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"With his wife doing a book tour, a father of twelve must handle a new job and his unstable brood.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0349205/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PWNYCNY"},"dateCreated":"2010-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Zzzzzzzzzz.","reviewBody":"When watching this movie one is reminded of the word insipid. This movie is appropriate for pre-school age children who have absolutely nothing else to do and would prefer watching images of kids and parents acting silly. Yes, silly is another word that applies to this movie. It is light fare, so light that it floats like a feather, going from one silly scene to another. Oh, another word to describe this movie is cute. Cute is nice but is it entertaining? Is it dramatic? Is it funny? The answer to all three questions is an emphatic no. A movie that cannot be taken seriously is either campy or a comedy and while this movie is not campy it isn't particularly funny either. Other words to describe this movie are schmaltzy, hokey and corny. This movie has the dramatic power of a fair weather cloud. Even Steve Martin cannot rescue this movie from the clutches of banality which can bring even the resolute movie watcher to the brink of boredom and even beyond, to the world of sleep. Zzzzzzzzz.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98696,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-03-17","keywords":"child vomiting,child answering the telephone,flip phone,telephone call,frog in pocket","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cheaper by the Dozen","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi29229337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRlNzhmNjktMmVmMi00YTI3LWI2ZDEtNDM0ZDA0MTg0NDczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRlNzhmNjktMmVmMi00YTI3LWI2ZDEtNDM0ZDA0MTg0NDczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001372/","name":"Bonnie Hunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240381/","name":"Hilary Duff"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506613/","name":"Shawn Levy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033486/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318326/","name":"Frank B. programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
Der Kaufhaus Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkowalski"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost painful...","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this movie, I was more than anxious to see it. Then I saw another one and it made me see it even more. Then I saw the movie and guess what, all the good scenes were those that I've already seen and nothing more. The idea itself is a very interesting one at very least, but it's the realization is where the movie fails. The story begins to borderline on being boring halfway through, and it all begins to be more than predictable. Once or twice the story takes an engaging turn, but it's really not enough. The funny parts are to be counted on the fingers of one hand, and the ending is -again- so predictable, it hurts. Which is a shame, because the acting is really good, Kevin James is truly shining through and proving that he's a really good actor; again, not nearly enough to salvage the shortcomings of the plot and the lack of jokes. Which is a shame. Movie starts really promising, but the further we go into the movie, the more painful it becomes to watch it. As if the makers gave up on it after shooting the first 30 minutes. I'm giving it 5 stars only because the first half an hour is really decent. And I gotta admire James doing all his stunts. So do yourself a favor. Don't watch the movie. Watch the trailers. That's all you need to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
Der Kaufhaus Cop 2
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2: Directed by Andy Fickman. With Kevin James, Raini Rodriguez, Neal McDonough, Daniella Alonso. After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3450650/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwMjkxNDQ1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDQwODIxNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3450650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Wizard-8"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"More of the same","reviewBody":"Although the original "Paul Blart: Mall Cop" was a box office hit, I don't think anyone was exactly clamouring for a sequel. But here one is, and it's pretty much like the first movie, namely that it's a comic take on the formula the action movie "Die Hard" gave birth to. While there are a handful of gags that this adult did find to be (mildly) amusing, the humor for the most part is simple-minded and lame, with a number of gags recycled from the first movie. Kids (YOUNG kids) might find the humor to be funny, but I think other adults like myself will sit in silence like I did. Is there anything of merit to be found in the movie? Well, Kevin James does bring in an instant likability, like he did in the first movie. But he really needs someone else to write his material. And the movie looks great, with expert photography and lighting that makes the colors pop out of your television set. So if your kids insist on dragging you to see this movie with them, make sure you get the Blu-ray disc."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2015-04-16","keywords":"2010s,security,guard,security guard,black","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4079988249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2263115/","name":"Raini Rodriguez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0895150/","name":"Eduardo Verástegui"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275698/","name":"Andy Fickman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: An American Pickle
An American Pickle
programme.desc: An American Pickle: Directed by Brandon Trost. With Seth Rogen, Sarah Snook, Molly Evensen, Eliot Glazer. An immigrant worker at a pickle factory is accidentally preserved for 100 years and wakes up in modern-day Brooklyn." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9059704/","name":"An American Pickle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRkZmZiNzUtMzgwYy00NTEzLWE2NjctMmI3NGI5ZTBiNDdkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzE3ODQxNjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"An immigrant worker at a pickle factory is accidentally preserved for 100 years and wakes up in modern-day Brooklyn.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9059704/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"G00fhunter"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Something to watch","reviewBody":"This movie was not bad but not good either.It kept my attention but wasn't anything spectacular or anything I'll even remember watching for that matter.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20691,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-08-06","keywords":"time travel,time traveler,immigrant,jewish,brooklyn","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3105799705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3MWM3MmYtYTdiNi00YmI4LWI2MTMtMjYzNzM4OTE1NzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3MWM3MmYtYTdiNi00YmI4LWI2MTMtMjYzNzM4OTE1NzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"AN AMERICAN PICKLE, directed by Brandon Trost, is based on Simon Rich's New Yorker novella and stars Seth Rogen as Herschel Greenbaum, a struggling laborer who immigrates to America in 1920 with dreams of building a better life for his beloved family. One day, while working at his factory job, he falls into a vat of pickles and is brined for 100 years. The brine preserves him perfectly and when he emerges in present-day Brooklyn, he finds that he hasn't aged a day. But when he seeks out his family, he is troubled to learn that his only surviving relative is his great-grandson, Ben Greenbaum (also played by Rogen), a mild-mannered computer coder whom Herschel can't even begin to understand."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3512758/","name":"Sarah Snook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6127780/","name":"Molly Evensen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1060930/","name":"Brandon Trost"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0345956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0719807/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026545/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2919995/","name":"Simon Rich"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Hangover
Hangover
programme.desc: The Hangover: Directed by Todd Phillips. With Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Justin Bartha. Three buddies wake up from a bachelor party in Las Vegas, with no memory of the previous night and the bachelor missing. They make their way around the city in order to find their friend before his wedding." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1119646/","name":"The Hangover","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGQwZjg5YmYtY2VkNC00NzliLTljYTctNzI5NmU3MjE2ODQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three buddies wake up from a bachelor party in Las Vegas, with no memory of the previous night and the bachelor missing. They make their way around the city in order to find their friend before his wedding.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1119646/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"agmancuso"},"dateCreated":"2009-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Heterosexuals in Sin City","reviewBody":"Yes, okay, it's very funny at times down right hilarious. What sets this comedy apart from others of its ilk, is a well structured script and a pace that doesn't allow any form of thinking. The chemistry between the four leads is also a plus. There is a surprising, maybe unconscious, touch of innocence in the midst of this night of debauchery that makes it palatable even charming. Bradley Cooper is coming into his own and I'm absolutely certain that he was born to play Emperor Caligula in a future Ridley Scott flick. The women, as in most films about a bunch of heterosexuals doing childish things, are treated appallingly. They are the enemy that they have to protect themselves from or just escape, run, run as fast and as far as you can. Try to find the hooker with a heart of gold, and if she looks like Heathter Graham, that much better and forget about settling down. "The Hangover" has already become the surprise hit of the summer 2009. I say, well done, it could have been worse","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":749303,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2009-07-29","keywords":"hangover,female nudity,bachelor party,implied cunnilingus,fellatio","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Hangover","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2650997529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzNjI1ODAwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjMzNDMyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzNjI1ODAwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjMzNDMyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Las Vegas, three groomsmen lose their about-to-be-wed buddy during their drunken misadventures, forcing them to retrace their steps in order to find him before the church bells ring."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0302108/","name":"Zach Galifianakis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177896/","name":"Bradley Cooper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0058581/","name":"Justin Bartha"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680846/","name":"Todd Phillips"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0221959/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524190/","name":"Jon Lucas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601859/","name":"Scott Moore"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
Hangover 2
programme.desc: The Hangover Part II: Directed by Todd Phillips. With Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Justin Bartha. Two years after the bachelor party in Las Vegas, Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug jet to Thailand for Stu's wedding. Stu's plan for a subdued pre-wedding brunch, however, goes seriously awry." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1411697/","name":"The Hangover Part II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2MTM4MzY2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQ3NzI4NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two years after the bachelor party in Las Vegas, Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug jet to Thailand for Stu's wedding. Stu's plan for a subdued pre-wedding brunch, however, goes seriously awry.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1411697/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lolabeningfield"},"dateCreated":"2011-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Re-hashing of Old Material","reviewBody":"I was really optimistic going into the theatre, I didn't expect it to as great as the original, but I thought it would still be good movie. But most of the material was stuff taken from the original only tweaked, and I hate to say it but I was actually bored for a good part of the movie. Some of the jokes/scenes dragged to long, to the point where I didn't find them funny anymore. There were some good moments, but the truly outrageous/original scenes that made the original so great were too few and far between. Some of the scenes were more outrageous in the sense that there was some full frontal nudity, but I'm not someone who finds that super entertaining. Overall it felt to me like a re-hash of stuff that had already been done with some naked people thrown in, and it just wasn't enjoyable like the first movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":480421,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-05-26","keywords":"wedding,strip club,pubic hair,hangover,bachelor party","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Hangover: Part II - Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2196348185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExOTE0Njc0MDFeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDUzNjU0MjMx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExOTE0Njc0MDFeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDUzNjU0MjMx._V1_.jpg","description":"Phil, Stu, Alan and Doug travel to Bangkok for Stu's wedding. programme.title: Fack ju Göhte 3
Fack Ju Göhte 3
programme.desc:
Fack ju Göhte 3: Directed by Bora Dagtekin. With Elyas M'Barek, Katja Riemann, Jella Haase, Sandra Hüller. A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6471264/","name":"Fack ju Göhte 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlkYWJjZDItNzA2OS00ZWZjLTg4NmItNWRjMjJjNTZlODU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6471264/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mrpanda-00412"},"dateCreated":"2017-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable, but nowhere as good as the first two movies","reviewBody":"This is the third part of a trilogy and as such the novelty of the scenario is fading. The first movie was surprisingly good and not as expected. The second movie played in an entirely different environment which added a few new elements to the story. Now the third movie's setting is back where it all started: at school.

To me it seemed like the movie does not really know what it wants to do. In the first two movies, the main protagonist (the ex-con teacher) gradually opened up to the children, became friendlier, and started to care for them. This movie reboots the whole thing by making our guy dislike the children at first, only to let him warm up throughout the movie once more. In general the movie seems to re-establish many things for viewers who have not seen the first two movies. The same thing goes for the jokes, which are very similar to the two previous movies, too similar even. Overall I just felt like the two movies never happened and we are seeing more or less the same thing again. Maybe this is why the first half-hour of the movie also seemed a bit like not having a clear purpose at all. The movie wants to establish the situation, but not really. It wants to continue where the predecessors left off, but not really. It throws around jokes that are not new, really.

The second part of the movie gets more interesting and starts following a clearer story-line, albeit in a linear and predictable way. This is not unsurprising for a comedy, but compared to the predecessors it is just not as good.

If you truly enjoyed the first two movies, you will still like this one. If you did not care for the first two movies, this one is definitely not for you. It suffers from exactly the same problems as similar trilogies at the point of the third installment. Take Despicable Me for example. Not a bad movie, just nothing new and no surprises for the viewer.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-26","keywords":"singing in a car,female teacher,teacher student relationship,teacher student conflict,munich germany","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153260825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065929/","name":"Elyas M'Barek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726257/","name":"Katja Riemann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3436464/","name":"Jella Haase"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 6471264, Title: Fack ju Göhte 3, --- Description: Fack ju Göhte 3: Directed by Bora Dagtekin. With Elyas M'Barek, Katja Riemann, Jella Haase, Sandra Hüller. A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6471264/","name":"Fack ju Göhte 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlkYWJjZDItNzA2OS00ZWZjLTg4NmItNWRjMjJjNTZlODU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6471264/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mrpanda-00412","dateCreated":"2017-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable, but nowhere as good as the first two movies","reviewBody":"This is the third part of a trilogy and as such the novelty of the scenario is fading. The first movie was surprisingly good and not as expected. The second movie played in an entirely different environment which added a few new elements to the story. Now the third movie's setting is back where it all started: at school.

To me it seemed like the movie does not really know what it wants to do. In the first two movies, the main protagonist (the ex-con teacher) gradually opened up to the children, became friendlier, and started to care for them. This movie reboots the whole thing by making our guy dislike the children at first, only to let him warm up throughout the movie once more. In general the movie seems to re-establish many things for viewers who have not seen the first two movies. The same thing goes for the jokes, which are very similar to the two previous movies, too similar even. Overall I just felt like the two movies never happened and we are seeing more or less the same thing again. Maybe this is why the first half-hour of the movie also seemed a bit like not having a clear purpose at all. The movie wants to establish the situation, but not really. It wants to continue where the predecessors left off, but not really. It throws around jokes that are not new, really.

The second part of the movie gets more interesting and starts following a clearer story-line, albeit in a linear and predictable way. This is not unsurprising for a comedy, but compared to the predecessors it is just not as good.

If you truly enjoyed the first two movies, you will still like this one. If you did not care for the first two movies, this one is definitely not for you. It suffers from exactly the same problems as similar trilogies at the point of the third installment. Take Despicable Me for example. Not a bad movie, just nothing new and no surprises for the viewer.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-26","keywords":"singing in a car,female teacher,teacher student relationship,teacher student conflict,munich germany","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153260825","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065929/","name":"Elyas M'Barek","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726257/","name":"Katja Riemann","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3436464/","name":"Jella Haase"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"],"duration":"PT2H"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Unfinished Business
Big Business – Ausser Spesen nichts gewesen
programme.desc:
Unfinished Business: Directed by Ken Scott. With Vince Vaughn, Tom Wilkinson, Dave Franco, Sienna Miller. A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2358925/","name":"Unfinished Business","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMwYjc3ZWEtNjMxNS00MzdkLWEwYWQtYWRkMDUwZWRhMjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2358925/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"maclock"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amusing","reviewBody":"Unfinished Business was a welcome surprise. Based on what I had read about it, I was prepared to leave the theatre underwhelmed and disappointed. That did not happen, though.

Vince Vaughn and Tom Wilkinson were amusing in their roles and they seemed to get things more right than wrong when it came to delivery and to timing. The character of their simple sidekick was more than a bit annoying, but it was good to see that the characters played by Vaughn and Wilkinson cut him a lot of slack. In short, this is a better movie than many IMDb amateur reviewers would have you believe. 

I found myself chuckling more than a few times, laughing at their antics and the absurdity of it all. This was a charming and amusing film in the end. If I were to guess, then some of the reviewers here may have felt discomfort over the depictions of drinking, drug use, and sexuality in this picture. So it goes. Recommended viewing for the non-church going set."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33094,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-08","keywords":"male nudity,business trip,company,glory hole,businessman","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1415687705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every imaginable - and unimaginable - way, including unplanned stops at a massive sex fetish event and a global economic summit.

programme.title: Vorwärts immer
Vorwärts Immer
programme.desc:
Vorwärts immer!: Directed by Francis Meletzky. With Jörg Schüttauf, Josefine Preuß, Jacob Matschenz, Hedi Kriegeskotte. Berlin 1989, shortly before the fall of the Wall: While the actor Otto is rehearsing for his role as head of state and party leader Erich Honecker, the regime is fighting for survival. The military and police are preparing to use force to crush the Leipzig Monday demonstration in the evening. To protect his pregnant daughter Anne, who wants to get forged papers for her escape from the republic in Leipzig, of all days, Otto comes up with a daring plan: disguised as Honecker, he wants to withdraw the order to shoot. The opportunity is good because the real head of state is out hunting all day. Others also want to use his absence: Crown Prince Krenz and Stasi chief Mielke, who are secretly preparing a change of power in the Central Committee. The putschists are all the more astonished when they suddenly see Honecker in front of them. Otto plays the role of his life - but unfortunately the unexpected appearance of Margot, the secret ruler of the workers 'and peasants' state, thwarted his plans at the last minute. Meanwhile, the Stasi is on the heels of his daughter and her contact August, who is secretly filming for western television. And Anne has someone else on her cheek: her jealous friend Matti. He wants to dissuade her from her escape plans - and above all to pull away from August." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5307194/","name":"Vorwärts immer!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQyMzlkOTQtNDA0ZS00NWY0LTgxMGMtMWFiYTE1NDYwYmZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Berlin 1989, shortly before the fall of the Wall: While the actor Otto is rehearsing for his role as head of state and party leader Erich Honecker, the regime is fighting for survival. The military and police are preparing to use for","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5307194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sheilabee-52230"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's true. You need to know the era.","reviewBody":"Having said that, if you do know it then it is a ridiculously funny film.

I'm a non-german but with ties to the GDR and I lived in the BRD for years. I'm amazed how they (all involved) carried it off so 'convincingly', the whole sound and feel of the film. I've just watched it again mainly because there wasn't much else on that evening, given covid and all. I'm so glad I did. I'd forgotten quite how silly it is and I really needed a good laugh.

It takes away nothing of the hard and serious times people were going through. It doesn't make a mockery of them. It's target is the party/state centre. I'm aware that I'm repeating most of what another reviewer has already said, but it wants saying again. This film is worth seeing because it's a funny film and because, whilst I understand there are many who might not want to be reminded of the period, we need to remember it. And we may as well be laughing when we do it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":286,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-12","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0778335/","name":"Jörg Schüttauf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0559326/","name":"Jacob Matschenz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0577641/","name":"Francis Meletzky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061958/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0201642/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2550656/","name":"Markus Thebe"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

The military and police are preparing to use for","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5307194/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sheilabee-52230","dateCreated":"2020-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's true. You need to know the era.","reviewBody":"Having said that, if you do know it then it is a ridiculously funny film.

I'm a non-german but with ties to the GDR and I lived in the BRD for years. I'm amazed how they (all involved) carried it off so 'convincingly', the whole sound and feel of the film. I've just watched it again mainly because there wasn't much else on that evening, given covid and all. I'm so glad I did. I'd forgotten quite how silly it is and I really needed a good laugh.

It takes away nothing of the hard and serious times people were going through. It doesn't make a mockery of them. It's target is the party/state centre. I'm aware that I'm repeating most of what another reviewer has already said, but it wants saying again. This film is worth seeing because it's a funny film and because, whilst I understand there are many who might not want to be reminded of the period, we need to remember it. And we may as well be laughing when we do it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":286,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5,"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-12","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0778335/","name":"Jörg Schüttauf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0559326/","name":"Jacob Matschenz"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0577641/","name":"Francis Meletzky"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061958/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0201642/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076073/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2550656/","name":"Markus Thebe"],"duration":"PT1H34M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
Der Kaufhaus Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkowalski"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost painful...","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this movie, I was more than anxious to see it. Then I saw another one and it made me see it even more. Then I saw the movie and guess what, all the good scenes were those that I've already seen and nothing more. The idea itself is a very interesting one at very least, but it's the realization is where the movie fails. The story begins to borderline on being boring halfway through, and it all begins to be more than predictable. Once or twice the story takes an engaging turn, but it's really not enough. The funny parts are to be counted on the fingers of one hand, and the ending is -again- so predictable, it hurts. Which is a shame, because the acting is really good, Kevin James is truly shining through and proving that he's a really good actor; again, not nearly enough to salvage the shortcomings of the plot and the lack of jokes. Which is a shame. Movie starts really promising, but the further we go into the movie, the more painful it becomes to watch it. As if the makers gave up on it after shooting the first 30 minutes. I'm giving it 5 stars only because the first half an hour is really decent. And I gotta admire James doing all his stunts. So do yourself a favor. Don't watch the movie. Watch the trailers. That's all you need to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
Der Kaufhaus Cop 2
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2: Directed by Andy Fickman. With Kevin James, Raini Rodriguez, Neal McDonough, Daniella Alonso. After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3450650/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwMjkxNDQ1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDQwODIxNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3450650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Wizard-8"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"More of the same","reviewBody":"Although the original "Paul Blart: Mall Cop" was a box office hit, I don't think anyone was exactly clamouring for a sequel. But here one is, and it's pretty much like the first movie, namely that it's a comic take on the formula the action movie "Die Hard" gave birth to. While there are a handful of gags that this adult did find to be (mildly) amusing, the humor for the most part is simple-minded and lame, with a number of gags recycled from the first movie. Kids (YOUNG kids) might find the humor to be funny, but I think other adults like myself will sit in silence like I did. Is there anything of merit to be found in the movie? Well, Kevin James does bring in an instant likability, like he did in the first movie. But he really needs someone else to write his material. And the movie looks great, with expert photography and lighting that makes the colors pop out of your television set. So if your kids insist on dragging you to see this movie with them, make sure you get the Blu-ray disc."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2015-04-16","keywords":"2010s,security,guard,security guard,black","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4079988249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2263115/","name":"Raini Rodriguez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0895150/","name":"Eduardo Verástegui"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275698/","name":"Andy Fickman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

Piss off, Snow White." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5872472/","name":"Verpiss Dich, Schneewittchen","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmZmOTFlZmYtNzBiNC00N2FlLWIwM2YtMDcxNzVlYmUxYzc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Piss off, Snow White.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5872472/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Snow White this isn't","reviewBody":"I did not know anything about this movie before I started watching it - apart from the title that is and the fact this is a comedy. I also think I recognize the main actor as a standup comedian. Though I don't really know many of them, so I may be wrong with that.\n\nJust letting you know, where I stand since some may be more familiar with him. I did recognize some of the other actors and some rappers too. The movie tries its best and I don't mean that in a bad way. Surely some will like its humor and its mellow tone and silly comedy. It is quite predictable, but the characters are likeable (mostly that is) and the actors are good too. This may just float your boat, if you're in the mood for it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":274,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.8},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2018-03-29","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3985619737","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2N2NjYTEtNzY4NC00MzQ4LThlMmQtNGQxYzQwOTRiODhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2N2NjYTEtNzY4NC00MzQ4LThlMmQtNGQxYzQwOTRiODhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2977411/","name":"Nilam Farooq"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1391248/","name":"Kida Khodr Ramadan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2677390/","name":"Cüneyt Kaya"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0070505/","name":"Rainer Bender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2651653/","name":"Mathias Brod"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3429606/","name":"Stefan Höh"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

I also think I recognize the main actor as a standup comedian. Though I don't really know many of them, so I may be wrong with that.\n\nJust letting you know, where I stand since some may be more familiar with him. I did recognize some of the other actors and some rappers too. The movie tries its best and I don't mean that in a bad way. Surely some will like its humor and its mellow tone and silly comedy. It is quite predictable, but the characters are likeable (mostly that is) and the actors are good too.
